column1: # IoTecha Log Analyzer — Known Error Signatures V2 (Source-Informed)
# Built from: error registry (363 errors/44 modules), source code (layer3-iotc), product configs (layer4)

Connection token is failed\ti2p2/MQTT\tHIGH\tMQTT Connection Token Failure\tAWS IoT Core connection interrupted — token negotiation failing repeatedly\t1. Check SIM/network path to AWS endpoint 2. Verify MQTT certificates via CertManager 3. Review i2p2 connectionMonitor.Timeout\t
MQTT.*fail\ti2p2/MQTT\tHIGH\tMQTT Connection Failure\tAWS IoT broker unreachable or rejecting connections\tCheck network connectivity, verify thing policy and certificates\t
MQTT.*DISCONNECTED\ti2p2/MQTT\tMEDIUM\tMQTT Disconnect Event\tBroker disconnect due to keep-alive timeout or network interruption\tReview connectionMonitor.Timeout, check network stability\t

ShadowUpdater.*Failed to get network stat\ti2p2/Shadow\tMEDIUM\tDevice Shadow Update Failure\tCannot read ppp0 interface stats for shadow — ppp0 not established\tFix PPP/cellular connectivity first (NetworkBoss), then shadow updates will resume\t
Can not read file.*mb_serial\ti2p2/DeviceInfo\tLOW\tDevice Serial Read Failure\tManufacturing serial file not found at /run/media/mfr/mb_serial\tCheck factory provisioning, verify partition mount\t
Can not read file.*firmware\ti2p2/DeviceInfo\tLOW\tFirmware Version Read Failure\t/proc/firmware/version or build_id not present\tNon-critical — affects telemetry only\t
lastUpdate.txt\ti2p2/FirmwareUpdate\tLOW\tFWUpdate Status File Missing\tLast firmware update record not found\tNon-critical on first boot; check if FOTA ever succeeded\t

PPP.*never.*established\tNetworkBoss/PPP\tCRITICAL\tPPP/Cellular Not Established\tCellular modem failed to establish PPP — SIM fault, no signal, or APN misconfigured\t1. Check SIM status (AT+CPIN?) 2. Check signal (AT+CSQ) 3. Verify APN in NetworkBoss config 4. Check modem device (/dev/ttyUSB2)\t
PPP.*down\tNetworkBoss/PPP\tHIGH\tPPP Link Down\tCellular backup link went offline\t1. Verify SIM is active with carrier 2. Check APN setting 3. Inspect pppd logs for LCP/IPCP errors\t

ppp0.*missing\tNetworkBoss/PPP\tMEDIUM\tPPP Interface Missing\tppp0 not present — PPP daemon not started or modem not detected\t1. Check modem presence (lsusb) 2. Verify ppp0.enabled=true in config 3. Restart NetworkBoss\t

Setting metric of ppp0.*failed.*does not exist\tNetworkBoss/PPP\tMEDIUM\tPPP Interface Selection Failure\tInterfaceSelectionManager cannot set routing metric for ppp0 — interface not up\tResolve PPP connectivity; interface selection will auto-recover\t

ppp-igniter.*not connected\tNetworkBoss/PPP\tHIGH\tPPP Igniter Not Connected\tPPP igniter PMQ channel not connected — NetworkBoss cannot trigger PPP setup\t1. Check NetworkBoss started before ppp-igniter 2. Verify init script order\t

Ethernet status changed.*waiting for stable\tNetworkBoss/Ethernet\tMEDIUM\tEthernet Link Instability\tEthernet link state changing — waiting for stabilization (12 checks)\tCheck cable, switch port, PHY negotiation; usually self-resolves\t

eth.*flap\tNetworkBoss/Ethernet\tHIGH\tEthernet Link Flapping\tPHY link toggling — bad cable, switch port, or autoneg issue\t1. Replace/reseat Ethernet cable 2. Try fixed speed (ethtool) 3. Check switch port\t

Error during interfaces initialization\tNetworkBoss/Init\tHIGH\tNetwork Interfaces Init Error\tNetworkBoss failed to initialize one or more network interfaces at startup\t1. Check network config 2. Verify hardware present 3. Review modem/WiFi driver load\t
WiFi.*fail\tNetworkBoss/WiFi\tMEDIUM\tWiFi Connection Failure\tWiFi association or authentication failing\tVerify SSID/password, check signal strength, review wpa_supplicant config\t
wlan0-ap.*captivePortal\tNetworkBoss/WiFiAP\tLOW\tWiFi AP Captive Portal Active\tWiFi access point with captive portal running — informational\tNormal for commissioning mode\t

interfaceSelectionManager.*availabilityChecker.*ping\tNetworkBoss/ISM\tMEDIUM\tInterface Availability Check Failure\tISM ping-based availability check failing — no reachable upstream\t1. Check DNS resolution 2. Verify OCPP CS URL reachable 3. Check all interface routes\t

Direct queue not connected\tPMQ\tMEDIUM\tPMQ Queue Not Connected\tPMQ direct queue destination not yet available — target process not started or crashed\tUsually transient at boot; persistent errors mean target process failed to start\t
Cant send message.*queue size limit\tPMQ\tMEDIUM\tPMQ Queue Full\tPMQ message queue full — receiver not consuming messages\tCheck target process health, may need restart; review queue size config\t
Subscribing again\tPMQ\tLOW\tPMQ Resubscription\tPMQ subscriber retrying connection to publisher queue\tTransient at boot; persistent means publisher process not running\t
ThreadAlarm.*timeout detected\tPMQ\tMEDIUM\tPMQ Thread Timeout\tPMQ thread detected blocking operation exceeding timeout\tReview which FD type is blocking; may indicate I/O or locking issue\t

POWER_BOARD_FAULT\tChargerApp/PowerBoard\tHIGH\tPower Board Fault (EVIC)\tEVIC reported stop reason 22: POWER_BOARD_FAULT\t1. Check power board firmware version 2. Inspect relay/contactor state 3. Review HW diagnostics 4. Replace power board if persistent\t

PB Version wait timeout\tChargerApp/PowerBoard\tHIGH\tPower Board Version Timeout\tHAL timed out waiting for power board firmware version response\t1. Check power board connection 2. Verify PB firmware updated 3. Check I2C/SPI bus\t

I2C.*Got Error IRQ\tChargerApp/I2C\tMEDIUM\tI2C Communication Error\tI2C bus error interrupt from EVIC power board communication\t1. Check I2C wiring 2. Verify pull-up resistors 3. Check for bus contention\t
Failed to export.*GPIO\tChargerApp/GPIO\tLOW\tGPIO Export Warning\tGPIO pin already exported by another process — will try to reuse\tUsually non-critical; check for duplicate GPIO consumers\t

CPState.*fault\tChargerApp/CP\tHIGH\tControl Pilot State Fault\tCP state machine detected fault — CPStateE or CPStateF\t1. Check CP circuit and diode 2. Verify vehicle connector 3. Inspect EVIC board [On-site service may be required]\t

EVCC.*watchdog\tChargerApp/EVCC\tLOW\tEVCC Watchdog Warning\tEVCC communication watchdog triggered — timing issue between components\tUsually non-critical; monitor if charging sessions complete normally\t

GlobalStop\tChargerApp/EVIC\tHIGH\tCharging Global Stop\tCharging session stopped by error condition — EVIC triggered GlobalStop\t1. Check ErrorBoss for specific error details 2. Review EVIC hardware 3. Check CP/PP state [On-site service may be required]\t

ContactorWelded\tChargerApp/Contactor\tCRITICAL\tContactor Welded Detection\tContactor detected as welded — safety-critical hardware failure\t1. IMMEDIATELY disable station 2. Replace contactor 3. Check welding detection circuit [On-site service REQUIRED]\t

EmergencyStop\tSafety/EmergencyStop\tCRITICAL\tEmergency Stop Triggered\tExternal emergency stop line was activated\t1. Check emergency stop button state 2. Reset after clearing cause 3. Verify E-stop circuit [On-site service REQUIRED]\t

V2G.*ConnectionClosed\tHLC/V2G\tHIGH\tV2G TCP Connection Closed\tISO 15118 V2G TCP session closed unexpectedly\t1. Check PLC communication (SLAC) 2. Verify V2G certificates 3. Review vehicle compatibility\t

V2G.*timeout\tHLC/V2G\tHIGH\tV2G Protocol Timeout\tISO 15118 message exchange timed out — vehicle or EVSE response too slow\t1. Check PLC link quality 2. Review timeout settings in ChargerApp config 3. Try different vehicle\t
V2G.*sequence.*error\tHLC/V2G\tMEDIUM\tV2G Session Sequence Error\tISO 15118 message received in wrong session state\tUsually vehicle-side issue; check SECC state machine logs\t
V2G.*schema.*not.*found\tHLC/V2G\tMEDIUM\tV2G Schema Mismatch\tCannot find compatible V2G schema for vehicle request\tVerify supported schemas (DIN/ISO 15118-2/ISO 15118-20), update if needed\t
V2G.*Certificate\tHLC/V2G\tMEDIUM\tV2G Certificate Issue\tISO 15118 certificate installation/update problem\tCheck V2G root certs, verify cert chain, review CertManager V2G slot\t

CableCheck.*fail\tHLC/CableCheck\tHIGH\tDC Cable Check Failure\tCable check precondition not met — IMD, voltage, or rectifier issue\t1. Check IMD module 2. Verify cable connection 3. Review rectifier status [On-site service may be required]\t

Precharge.*timeout\tHLC/Precharge\tHIGH\tDC Precharge Timeout\tVehicle precharge phase timed out — DC voltage matching failed\t1. Check rectifier output 2. Verify vehicle battery voltage 3. Review precharge settings\t

BootNotification.*failed\tOCPP/Boot\tHIGH\tOCPP BootNotification Failed\tBootNotification message failed — network not established at OCPP boot time\t1. Ensure network ready before OCPP starts 2. Check CS URL 3. Verify TLS certificates\t

BootNotification.*reject\tOCPP/Boot\tHIGH\tOCPP BootNotification Rejected\tCSMS rejected BootNotification — charger not authorized on backend\t1. Register charger serial on CSMS 2. Verify chargePointVendor/Model match 3. Check CSMS logs\t
WebSocket.*fail\tOCPP/WebSocket\tHIGH\tOCPP WebSocket Failure\tWebSocket connection to Central System failing\t1. Check CS URL 2. Verify TLS certificates 3. Check network connectivity\t

Connection must be established\tOCPP/Connection\tHIGH\tOCPP Connection Not Established\tOCPP trying to send message but WebSocket not connected\tResolve network connectivity; OCPP will auto-reconnect (OfflineTimeout_s=300)\t
Unexpected response received\tOCPP/Protocol\tLOW\tOCPP Unexpected Response\tOCPP received unexpected PMQ data type — protocol mismatch or timing\tUsually transient; check PMQ routing if persistent\t

Unknown unconsumed event\tOCPP/StateMachine\tLOW\tOCPP State Machine Event Drop\tOCPP state machine received event it cannot handle in current state\tUsually harmless; check state machine transitions if charging fails\t
Boot source file.*doesn.t exist\tOCPP/Boot\tLOW\tOCPP Boot Source File Missing\t/proc/boot_source not present — cannot detect boot partition\tNon-critical; affects diagnostics reporting only\t

ENERGY_MANAGER_POWER_IMBALANCE\tEnergyManager/Balance\tHIGH\tPhase Power Imbalance\t3-phase power imbalance detected — one or more phases not carrying expected load\t1. Check phase connections 2. Verify meter readings 3. Review grid connection\t
LimitsStorage.*DELETE\tEnergyManager/DB\tLOW\tEnergyManager Limits Reset\tLimits being cleared from storage — normal on session/config change\tInformational — part of normal limits lifecycle\t

No3phCurrentFlow\tEnergyManager/3Phase\tHIGH\tNo 3-Phase Current Flow\tNo current detected on some phases during 3-phase BPT session\t1. Check all phase connections 2. Verify meter wiring 3. Review contactor state\t

Failed to read cert config.*skip\tCertManager/Config\tMEDIUM\tCertificate Config Read Failure\tCertificate root PEM file not found — slot skipped\t1. Check cert provisioning 2. Verify root cert files on filesystem 3. Re-provision if missing\t

Failed to read certs config\tCertManager/Config\tMEDIUM\tCertificate Key File Missing\tCertificate key PEM not found at expected path\t1. Check key provisioning 2. Verify TPM key extraction 3. Re-provision\t
Snapshot is empty\tCertManager/Snapshot\tLOW\tCertManager Empty Snapshot\tCertificate snapshot empty — no certs loaded yet\tMay be normal on first boot; check if certs provision during startup\t

Can.t create GPIORebooter\tHealthMonitor/GPIO\tMEDIUM\tGPIO Rebooter Unavailable\tHealth monitor cannot create GPIO rebooter — file access failed\t1. Check GPIO hardware 2. Verify permissions 3. Check if running in container/VM\t

SoftReset\tHealthMonitor/Reboot\tMEDIUM\tSoft Reset Uptime Threshold\tHealth monitor triggered soft reboot after uptime threshold reached\tDesigned behavior — check softResetUptime threshold if too frequent\t

Unplanned.*reboot\tHealthMonitor/Reboot\tHIGH\tUnplanned Reboot Detected\tReboot occurred without health monitor initiating it — power loss or crash\t1. Check power supply stability 2. Review kernel panic logs 3. Check watchdog config\t

eMMC.*wearing.*high\tHealth/Storage\tMEDIUM\teMMC High Wearing\teMMC flash storage write wearing approaching limit\t1. Reduce logging verbosity 2. Move frequent writes to tmpfs 3. Plan hardware replacement\t

eMMC.*wearing.*critical\tHealth/Storage\tCRITICAL\teMMC Critical Wearing\teMMC flash at critical wear level — imminent failure risk\t1. URGENT: Plan hardware replacement 2. Reduce all writes 3. Backup config [On-site service REQUIRED]\t

FSSwitchToRO\tHealth/Storage\tCRITICAL\tFilesystem Switched to Read-Only\tFilesystem unexpectedly mounted read-only — possible disk/flash corruption\t1. Check dmesg for I/O errors 2. Run fsck 3. Check eMMC health [On-site service may be required]\t

StorageFallbackMode\tHealth/Storage\tCRITICAL\tStorage Fallback Mode Active\tSystem running in fallback storage mode — primary partition unavailable\t1. Check partition table 2. Review RAUC slot status 3. Flash recovery image [On-site service REQUIRED]\t

error_block_all_sessions\tErrorBoss\tCRITICAL\tSession-Blocking Error Active\tErrorBoss has active error_block_all_sessions — no charging possible\tReview ErrorBoss output for specific error; may require power cycle or on-site service\t
locked_warning\tErrorBoss\tHIGH\tLocked Warning Active\tErrorBoss has locked warning that persists across sessions\tReview specific error; typically requires manual intervention or power cycle\t

Update.*validation.*failed\tFirmwareUpdate\tHIGH\tFirmware Update Validation Failed\tFOTA update failed signature, checksum, certificate, or variant validation\t1. Re-trigger update from CSMS 2. Verify update package integrity 3. Check signing certificates\t
iotc-power-board-firmware-updater\tFirmwareUpdate/PowerBoard\tLOW\tPower Board FW Updater Active\tPower board firmware updater running — informational\tNormal during PB firmware update process\t
Process.*restarted\tMonit/Process\tMEDIUM\tProcess Restarted by Monit\tMonit detected process crash and restarted it\tCheck process logs for crash cause; frequent restarts indicate systemic issue\t

restarted too often\tMonit/Process\tHIGH\tExcessive Process Restarts\tMonit reports process crashing and restarting too frequently\t1. Check process core dump 2. Review resource limits 3. Check dependencies\t
High.*CPU\tMonit/System\tMEDIUM\tHigh CPU Usage\tMonit detected sustained high CPU usage\tIdentify CPU-heavy process (top), check for infinite loops or resource contention\t
HMI.*not.*ready\tHMI/Board\tMEDIUM\tHMI Board Not Ready\tHMI display board not responding during initialization\t1. Check HMI board connection 2. Verify HMI firmware 3. Check SPI/UART bus\t
HMI.*timeout\tHMI/Board\tMEDIUM\tHMI Board Init Timeout\tHMI board initialization timed out\t1. Power cycle station 2. Check HMI board hardware 3. Verify HMI firmware version\t

Required.*Meter.*not.*found\tMeter\tMEDIUM\tRequired Meter Not Found\tEnergy meter required for billing/Eichrecht not detected\t1. Check meter wiring 2. Verify Modbus address 3. Check RS485 bus termination\t
Meter.*Connection.*Failed\tMeter\tHIGH\tMeter Connection Failed\tCommunication with energy meter failed\t1. Check RS485 wiring 2. Verify baud rate 3. Check meter power supply\t

EICHRECHT.*ERROR\tMeter/Eichrecht\tCRITICAL\tEichrecht Metering Error\tLegal metering (Eichrecht) in error state — billing integrity compromised\t1. Check meter status 2. Verify calibration seal 3. Contact metering authority [On-site service REQUIRED]\t

LidOpen\tSafety/Tamper\tHIGH\tCharger Lid Open Detection\tTamper detection: charger enclosure lid is open\t1. Close lid 2. Check lid sensor 3. Verify tamper detection circuit [On-site service REQUIRED]\t
kernel.*panic\tKernel\tCRITICAL\tKernel Panic\tKernel panic — system crash requiring reboot\t1. Check dmesg/kern.log for cause 2. Review memory usage 3. Check driver compatibility\t
Oops\tKernel\tCRITICAL\tKernel Oops\tKernel oops detected — driver or memory error\t1. Identify faulting module from oops dump 2. Check driver versions 3. Review memory\t
PHY.*down\tKernel/Network\tMEDIUM\tPHY Link Down\tEthernet PHY reporting link down event\tCheck physical cable and switch port\t
TPM.*error\tKernel/TPM\tLOW\tTPM Communication Warning\tTPM chip communication issue — may affect cert operations\tUsually transient; persistent errors may indicate hardware issue\t

remount.*read-only\tKernel/FS\tCRITICAL\tFilesystem Remounted Read-Only\tKernel forcibly remounted filesystem as read-only due to errors\t1. Check dmesg for I/O errors 2. Run fsck 3. Check eMMC/flash health [On-site service may be required]\t

config_manager.*not connected\tConfigManager\tMEDIUM\tConfigManager Not Connected\tComponents cannot reach ConfigManager — config updates will fail\tCheck ConfigManager process health, review PMQ connectivity\t

UnderFrequency\tGridCodes/AIM\tCRITICAL\tGrid Under-Frequency Disconnection\tGrid frequency below threshold — inverter disconnected for safety\t1. Check grid connection 2. Verify frequency settings 3. Wait for grid stabilization\t

OverFrequency\tGridCodes/AIM\tCRITICAL\tGrid Over-Frequency Disconnection\tGrid frequency above threshold — inverter disconnected\t1. Check grid connection 2. Verify frequency settings 3. Wait for grid stabilization\t

GridFault.*Voltage\tGridCodes/AIM\tCRITICAL\tGrid Voltage Fault\tGrid voltage out of tolerance — inverter disconnected for safety\t1. Check grid connection 2. Verify voltage at service entrance 3. Contact utility if persistent\t

column5: PMQ message loop FD poll exceeded 1000ms — CPU starvation or I/O blocking
column6: 1. Check CPU usage with top/htop 2. Check storage I/O with iostat 3. Review Monit for crashed services 4. Power cycle if persistent

column5: Message producer outpacing consumer — messages being dropped
column6: 1. Identify slow consumer in PMQ logs 2. Check if ErrorBoss or ConfigManager blocked 3. Review thread alarm counts

column5: IPC queue destination not ready at send time — normal at boot, persistent means service crashed
column6: 1. Check Monit for failed services 2. Verify boot order 3. Look for crashed services with stale queues

column5: Subscriber reconnecting to publisher — indicates service restart or slow startup
column6: Normal during boot sequence; persistent retries indicate publisher service not running

column5: Root CA chain file missing or unreadable — TLS connections may fail
column6: 1. Check /etc/iotecha/certs/ for missing .pem files 2. Verify CertManager config paths 3. Re-provision via OCPP InstallCertificate

column5: CertManager received unexpected PMQ response type
column6: 1. Check CertManager/OCPP message flow 2. Verify PMQ data type versions match

column5: RFID/token not in local whitelist — authorization rejected
column6: 1. Verify OCPP LocalAuthList 2. Check Authorize request/response flow 3. Review offline auth mode

column5: TokenManager registering with PMQ bus — informational during boot
column6: Normal during startup; errors only if followed by failure messages

column5: NetworkBoss adjusting routing metrics — interface flapping or connectivity check failing
column6: 1. Check affected interface (wlan0/eth0/ppp0) 2. For WiFi: check signal 3. For LTE: AT+CSQ 4. Review interfaceSelectionManager config

column5: NetworkBoss failed to initialize network stack
column6: 1. Check eth0 cable 2. Verify modem/SIM 3. Review NetworkBoss.properties 4. Check dmesg for driver errors 5. Power cycle

column5: HAL timed out waiting for Power Board firmware version response
column6: 1. Check Power Board serial connection 2. Verify Power Board firmware 3. Check for Power Board fault LEDs 4. Replace Power Board if persistent

column5: BootNotification will fail — CPModel not configured
column6: 1. Set chargePointModel in ocpp-cmd.properties 2. Verify ConfigManager delivered OCPP config 3. Check for factory provisioning issues
Non-critical; OCPP reports boot reason as unknown. May affect diagnostics only.

column5: SQLite VACUUM inside transaction — minor database housekeeping issue
column6: Non-critical; self-corrects on next cycle. Monitor for database corruption symptoms.

column5: Central System rejected BootNotification — charger cannot operate in online mode
column6: 1. Verify ChargePointVendor and Model in OCPP config 2. Check CSMS provisioning 3. Verify TLS certificates

column5: Using deprecated polling for Control Pilot state changes
column6: Non-critical; performance hint. Upgrade firmware to use callback-based CP monitoring.

column5: EVIC microcontroller reported error via I2C interrupt
column6: 1. Check EVIC I2C bus connection 2. Review interrupt code in EVIC firmware docs 3. Power cycle 4. Replace EVIC board if persistent

column5: Internal state machine lookup failed — connector in undefined state
column6: 1. Restart ChargerApp service 2. Power cycle charger 3. Report to IoTecha if persistent

column5: EVCC processing blocked for >60s — service will be stopped
column6: 1. Check PMQ thread alarms for system overload 2. Review CPU usage 3. Power cycle charger 4. Report to IoTecha with RACC

column5: Hardware watchdog GPIO not accessible — system cannot self-recover from hangs
column6: 1. Check /sys/class/gpio/ permissions 2. Verify kernel GPIO driver loaded 3. Non-critical in development/test environments

column5: Health Monitor initiated planned reboot after uptime threshold
column6: Normal maintenance reboot; check if frequency is excessive (>1/day)

column5: System restarted without planned reboot marker — crash, watchdog, or power loss
column6: 1. Check dmesg/kernel logs for panic/oops 2. Review power supply stability 3. Check for hardware watchdog timeout

column5: Hardware emergency stop line triggered — all charging sessions terminated
column6: 1. Check physical E-stop button 2. Verify E-stop wiring 3. Clear E-stop and reset 4. On-site service required

column5: Charger enclosure lid opened — tamper detection active
column6: 1. Secure charger lid 2. Check tamper sensor wiring 3. On-site inspection required

column1: # 246 entries auto-imported from error_registry.tsv for searcher coverage
# These complement hand-crafted patterns above with exact error name matches

column6: 1. Check lock is not blocked by some object   2. Check/fix/replace lock   3. Power Cycle Charging Station   4. Replace Power Board

column5: EV41: Reactive current was detected, increasing minimum limit
column6: 1. Restart charging session   2. Use another EV/consumer
1. Restart charging session   2. Use another EV/consumer

column5: Session stop because of reactive current level
column6: 1. Restart charging session   2. Use another EV
1. Restart charging session   2. Use another EV/connect another consumer   3. Verify M2LowCurrentThreshold_mA value in ihal/ihal.properties config
1. Power Cycle Charging Station   2. Replace Power Board

column5: An internal fault of the IMD unit happened outside 1s after closing relaysr
column6: 1. Restart charging session   2. Use another EV/consumer   3. Power Cycle Charging Station   4. Check Bender unit connection to Power Board   5. Replace Bender unit   6. Replace Power Board
